protocol_name: Nuclei isolation from human skeletal muscle
protocol_name_html: Nuclei isolation from human skeletal muscle
documents: [{"url":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/pr-journal/75f2ge6.docx","file_id":"30565","thumb_url":"https://www.protocols.io/img/extensions/docx.png","ofn":"Nuclei isolation from human skeletal muscle v6.docx"}]
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"82hno","text":"This protocol describes a methond of single nucleus isolaton from human skeletal muscle for snRNA sequencing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
status_info: We use this protocol in our group and it is working

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"2vct3","text":"Prepare 5ml Buffer A and 10ml Buffer B for each human sample","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3glrg","text":"Dissect all the hind limb muscles and place in a 35\/60mm tissue culture dish with 0.5ml PBS.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8rv2h","text":"Remove the fat from muscle using a scissors, and wash the muscle with 1X PBS twice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5448p","text":"Mechanically chop the muscle into 1mm pieces with a razor, mix the red and white muscles.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}
{"blocks":[{"key":"f2t9b","text":"Rinse the 7 ml dounce homogenizer with MiliQ water.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eecon","text":"Transfer the 0.3g of the mashed muscle into a 7 ml dounce homogenizer with 3ml of Buffer A using the razor (the rest of the muscle will be used for single cell isolation).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"42grh","text":"Ground the tissue on ice for 50 strokes with the loose Pestle A (clearance of 0.114 mm), try to avoid bubbles. Do not twist the pestle while pushing the pestle down. It might cause the nuclei degradation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7jcdc","text":"Filter the mixture passed through a 100micron strainer on top of a 50ml falcon tube. Rinse the dounce homogenizer with 1ml Buffer A and then wash through the cell strainer, collect into the 50ml falcon tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"absnf","text":"Repeat the washing with another 750ul of Buffer A. The combined tissue homogenate in the 50ml falcon tube now should be \u00b14.75ml.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d35aa","text":"add 250ul of Triton X-100 (10%) to the tissue homogenate to make the final concentration of Triton X-100 is 0.5%. Mix the solution gently by pipetting.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4qdl1","text":"Wash the 7 ml dounce homogenizer with MiliQ water for the next step.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2mf5e","text":"Placed the tissue homogenate back into a cleaned dounce homogenizer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5nrlj","text":"Ground the mixture an additional 50 strokes with the tight Pestle B (clearance of 0.076mm).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3kv3l","text":"Filter the mixture through a 40micron strainer. Leave the bubbles in the strainer and collect the filtered solution that accumulated on the bottom of the strainer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ir9k","text":"Centrifuge the tissue filtrate at 3000 x g for 5min at 4 degrees to get nuclei pellet. Remove the supernatant entirely.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dv7g3","text":"Re-suspend the nuclei pellet in 1ml Buffer B and transfer to a 1.5ml Eppendorf tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dhs59","text":"Prepare 4 new Eppendorf tubes, add 475 ul of Buffer B into each tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a6uia","text":"Gently mix the nuclei suspension by pipetting, and then take 225 ul of nuclei suspension and 300 ul of Percoll solution into each tube to create a 27% Percoll-nuclei solution. Mix by pipetting.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"arlls","text":"Centrifuge the Eppendorf tube at 20,000 x g for 15 minutes at 4 degrees, remove the supernatant and keep only the nuclei layer (pellet), note the tube orientation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6311v","text":"Re-suspend the nuclear layer into 200ul of Buffer B. Pool the nuclei suspensions from 4 tubes to one tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}
{"blocks":[{"key":"2s2jh","text":"Spin down the nuclei at 2500 x g for 3 minutes at 4C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9g9sp","text":"Remove the supernatant and add 1ml of buffer B. Gently disperse the pellet with pipetting and spin down the nuclei at 2500 x g for 3 minutes at 4C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9qv59","text":"Remove the supernatant and re-suspend the nuclei in 50-200 ul of Buffer B (the volume need to be adjusted according to the size of the pellet).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8pvfj","text":"Stain the intact nuclei using trypan blue (50:50) and quantify by counting with a hemocytometer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"aemnr","text":"Wash the pestles and homogenizers with water-80% EtOH and leave to dry out till next experiment.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}
